text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
hamburger cake pop tutorial where I'll
be showing you how to make this gorgeous

those of you following my channel my
cupcake addiction you will know that I
have a little bit obsessed with savory

goodies today we're doing the hamburger
cake pops tools and equipment that we
will be using today I've got my
polystyrene block I'm just resting my
pops in that today I've got three
ziplock bags I've got a pair of scissors
a couple of lollipop sticks I've got my
pre-rolled cakepop ball now for those of
you that don't have a great recipe for
getting your cake pop balls rolls and
ready to decorate I will leave a link to
our recipe and tutorial in the

that that is really quite firm that's
been refrigerated for about 15 to 20
minutes and it's really firm to touch
I've got four different colors of
chocolate so my main color is white
chocolate this is 98% white chocolate
we've just think I put four little dark
chocolate buglets in there or dark
chocolate melts and that's just to give
it that really really hint of brown like
the hamburger bun I've got three
different color candy melts so I've got
red green and yellow and you don't need
too much of each of those three spoons
and some sesame seeds the let's get
started now as I mentioned my cake pop
ball is really nice and firm the reason
for that is they're going to take one of
our spoons and we're just going to sort
of hollow out a bit of a divot this is
gonna be where our bits and pieces so
our meat and cheese and lettuce in the
form of candy melts is going to go so
just I'm just using the back of my spoon
but you could use the top of a knife or
anything like that and you just want to
hollow it a little bit of a centre so
don't be too fussy about it and once
you're done just roll it back in your
hands
to take off any rough edges but you
should have something that looks like
this now we want to take our cake pop
stick and we're going to dip it in a

now look at your ball if you've got a a

see how I think it's gonna look best I'm
gonna put mine that way so dipping your
kid your lollipop stick into that candy
melt for white chocolate and just
straight up into the center of your
hamburger we're gonna let that chocolate
seal completely set and then we'll come
back to dip and decorate all right so my
chocolate seal is nice and set which is
exactly how we want it it's time to dip
so just taking your cake pop just dunk
it down into that chocolate allow that
chocolate to flow up over that seal and
pull it out now you want to give it a
nice tap off to get rid of any excess
and you want to make sure you're turning

so your hamburger buns should be looking
something like this you can see we've

now take your sesame seeds while that's

out and we're going to get ourselves

you want the Reds to be
so I start with the middle color here
which I like to be red I just like the
way that it looks so I'm gonna take my
ziplock bag and I'm just gonna spoon
some of that red candy melt into the
ziplock bag
push it all the way to the end so your
actual cake pop doesn't have to be
completely dry for this you want it to
be a little bit sort of starting to sit
you don't want it to be still dripping
but does not be completely dry
taking your scissors just snip off just
a little corner there and we're just
fashioning that into a bit of a piping
bag and I start with the middle color
because we are going to let the middle
color completely dry and then it won't
run into our other two colors when we go
to finish off with the yellow and the

that little Ridge that you've carved out
you just want to just back and forward
and I make the red a little bit thicker
then I make the other two colors so I'm
just running it around there and I'm
kind of moving the bag back and forth
almost like just a shaky hand kind of
effect and that's just so that it
doesn't look too perfect we don't want
it to be a nice neat line so at this
stage you should have something that's
looking like this you now want to let
that completely set so we're just going
to set that back in the polystyrene
block for about five minutes or so until
that red candy melt and the rest of that
chocolate has completely set and then
we'll be back just to finish it off
alright so I'm happy that that one's now
completely set so it's time to get out
of two bags of candy melt ready that's
what the last one we're just going to
open those up green and a little bit of
yellow candy melt so some yellow in this
one
and a little bit of green in this one
pushing those all the way down to the
corner and then sealing up the bag make
sure you squeeze all of the air out of
it all right now with these ones I'm
gonna cut them really really fine
because we're gonna do sort of a little
squiggle detail so just the tiniest
tiniest little nick off the end of that
bag we're gonna do a bit of a squiggle
detail to give these a bit of texture so
for the top one you can see here I'm
just gonna take that nice fine point and
I'm just going to sort of just
haphazardly squiggle it around and up
and down you want to overlap with that
red layer you can see there with that
nice fine tip we're getting quite a bit
of texture in there and then we're going
to do the same with our cream these are
a really easy k-pop and they're really
effective but they do involve quite a
few steps with all via with all of the
drying so certainly a good one for
parties but do allow yourself a little
bit of time to make them once again with
the lettuce and I like to make the
lettuce really nice and squiggly and
also think about the different sizes of
the layers so I always like the the red
layer to be sort of my fattest layer in
the middle there the lettuce is normally
the I guess the thinnest with a green
all the way around so there you have
your gorgeous hamburger sandwich cake
